title: Super Micro Computer (SMCI) Found “Not In Compliance With Nasdaq Listing Rules,” Won’t Get Delisted Pending Appeal - Wccftech
summary: SUPER MICRO COMPUTER: RECEIVED LETTER FROM NASDAQ THAT CO IS NOT IN COMPLIANCE WITH NASDAQ LISTING RULE 5250(C)(1) — First Squawk (@FirstSquawk) November 20, 2024  To wit, as per the reports that are just trickling in, Super Micro Computer has received an official letter from the Nasdaq exchange, wherein the company was found "not in compliance with Nasdaq listing rule 5250(C)(1)." As we've repeated ad nauseam, Super Micro Computer's latest string of bad luck began in August when Hindenburg Research published a damning report, detailing a litany of malpractices at the firm. In response to this explosive report, Super Micro Computer delayed the filing of its annual report for FY 2024, presumably in a bid to undertake a comprehensive internal review. Note: An earlier version of the article erroneously implied that Super Micro Computer's compliance plan had been rejected by Nasdaq.
